Videos on Consumer Learning and Its Types and Importance
There are four elements noted concerning to the Behavioral Learning such as Motive, Cues, Response and Reinforcement. Motives is within the consumer, what drive the
consumer to buy the product it is pertaining to the unfulfilled needs. While Cues are the
stimuli that suggest a specific way to satisfy your motives. There are so many cues competing consumer attention, some are part of the external environment while there are
also created by other marketers and on social media. Response is the consumer’s reaction to a cue. Then the Reinforcement leads to brand loyalty because it deals with the reward,
enjoyment and benefits that the consumer received after buying a product.
There are two types of Consumer Learning theories Behavioral Learning and Cognitive Learning and this two types of learning both can be used to drive awareness and to convince
customer to purchase your product. Behavioral Learning is referred as stimulus-response theories, it focus on the learning occurs in response to external cues or stimuli. Classical
Conditioning, a well-studied theory of behavioral learning. It suggest that when two stimuli are

paired together to produce a particular learned response through repetition, and the absence
of one stimuli will produce the same response. Cognitive Learning says that the consumer doesn’t learn from association. This learning
focusing on how information is processed by the human mind and it is all about problem
solving. Gathering facts about the products or services process those facts then recalling them. Furthermore, the importance of this two types of learning is to make the consumer
aware to the products or services while in us marketer it helps us to develop successful strategies and campaigns that will drive their awareness, consideration and purchase to our
products and services.
Videos on Classical Conditioning and Theory of Learning
Classical conditioning is a form of learning by which a conditioned stimulus be transformed as associated with an unrelated unconditioned stimulus in order to produce a
behavioral response known as a conditioned response. The conditioned response is the learned response to the previously neutral stimulus. The unconditioned stimulus is usually a
biologically significant stimulus such as food or pain that elicits an unconditioned response from the start. The conditioned stimulus is usually neutral and produces no particular response at
first, but after conditioning it bring out the conditioned response. Classical conditioning is
established by Ivan Pavlov which known for his famous experiment with conditioning the salivation response in dogs, which brought about classical conditioning. He was a Russian
scientist whose work with dogs has been influential in understanding how learning occurs because of his research, the theory of Classical condition established.
Videos on Application of Classical Conditioning
In Classical Conditioning it explain many aspects of consumer behavior or human
behavior. It tackles about different emotional responses of human. Classical conditioning is not
just in the world of business, its application can be found also in school, or any post traumatic disorders that has something to do with their past. Application of Classical Conditioning is very
challenging for a brand manager because it requires patient and understanding. The brand

manager must possess good communication skill in order to apply the classical conditioning
properly. Classical conditioning is a process of modifying someone’s behavior. It is present in our everyday life. Advertising executives usually hired attractive and popular model to promote
their products because this has something to do with the brand image they want to possess.
The result is that the product is now appealing to their consumer and it may look like a better version of their product.
